pull_request.title: Add OQS_init and OQS_destroy & GithubCI on PRs
pull_request.body:
- Adds OQS_init() and OQS_destroy() on provider load / teardown (required after https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/pull/1431)
- Run GithubCI on PRs

Closes #144

pull_request.title: Rewrite endecode to remove internal dependences on OSSL
pull_request.body: Rewrite of encoders / decoders test to hopefully make it much more simpler and removing dependency on internal OSSL structures.

review.body: Thanks very much, @alexzas for this re-write: Much cleaner and easier to understand! The dependency is gone for good now as far as I can see. Please let me know if you'd like to see this merged as-is or whether you want to give the `jinja2` templating issue a go.

pull_request.title: Rewrite endecode to remove internal dependences on OSSL
pull_request.body: Rewrite of encoders / decoders test to hopefully make it much more simpler and removing dependency on internal OSSL structures.

review.body: Thank you for this contribution! It looks this is a bit of a "race condition" as #151 removes a good chunk of the OPENSSL_BLD/SRC dependencies. The remaining references moved in this PR from BLD->SRC (for "oqs_test_groups") also look like they should rather be completely eliminated. Would you be willing to look into this @distorted-mdw ? This would achieve the same goal (out of tree builds) without introducing a new variable.

pull_request.title: test/CMakeLists.txt: Tolerate out-of-tree builds of OpenSSL
pull_request.body:
Add a new variable `OEPNSSL_SRCTOP` to parallel the existing `OPENSSL_BLDTOP`.  This refers to the actual source directory, from which we find header files, rather than the build directory which contains libraries, most notably `libtestutil.a`.

As I've set things up, each variable defaults from the other.  This is probably not great long-term: it's intended as a transition measure.  It seems more sensible to me to have the source directory be the primary setting, and have the build directory be subsidiary; but existing scripts (and finger-macros) know nothing of the new source-directory setting, so preserving compatibility seems valuable for now.

<!-- Please give a brief explanation of the purpose of this pull request. -->

review.body: Thanks very much, @alexzas for this re-write: Much cleaner and easier to understand! The dependency is gone for good now as far as I can see. Please let me know if you'd like to see this merged as-is or whether you want to give the `jinja2` templating issue a go (edit/add: I'd otherwise add this in a separate PR).

pull_request.title: Rewrite endecode to remove internal dependences on OSSL
pull_request.body: Rewrite of encoders / decoders test to hopefully make it much more simpler and removing dependency on internal OSSL structures.

review.body: I guess that if it turns out using a `-C` flag is better, then we'll change this again easily.

pull_request.title: fix #202
pull_request.body: This allows to set the `OQS_PERMIT_UNSUPOPORTED_ARCHITECTURE` CMake option via an environment variable.
